SEARCH
Package a2

Class HawaiianWords

java.lang.Object
a2.HawaiianWords
public class HawaiianWords extends Object
Provides methods for computing the English pronunciation of Hawaiian words.

  • Field Summary

  • Field Details

    • VOWELS

      public static final String VOWELS
      String containing the vowels of the Hawaiian language.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • CONSONANTS

      public static final String CONSONANTS
      String containing the consonants of the Hawaiian language.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • CONSONANT_MAPPINGS

      public static final String[] CONSONANT_MAPPINGS
      Array mapping consonants to their English-sounding pronunciations. The consonants are found in the even-numbered indexes. For a consonant located at index i, its English-sounding pronunciation is found at index i+1.

      The consonant W is special in that its pronunciation changes if it immediately follows a vowel.

    • VOWEL_MAPPINGS

      public static final String[] VOWEL_MAPPINGS
      Array mapping vowels and vowel-pairs to their English-sounding pronunciations. The vowel or vowel pair are found in the even-numbered indexes. For a vowel or vowel pair located at index i, its English-sounding pronunciation is found at index i+1.

  • Method Details

    • mightBeValid

      public static boolean mightBeValid(String word)
      Returns true if and only if the string word is made up of only space characters, Hawaiian vowels, and Hawaiian consonants.
      Parameters:
      word - a string
      Returns:
      true if word might be a valid Hawaiian word, false otherwise

    • isVowel

      public static boolean isVowel(char c)
      Returns true if and only if c is a Hawaiian vowel.
      Parameters:
      c - a character
      Returns:
      true if and only if c is a Hawaiian vowel

      Returns true if and only if c is the 'okina character.
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • mapConsonant

      public static String mapConsonant(String s)
      Returns the English-sounding pronunciation of the consonant stored in s. The consonant W is special in that its pronunciation changes if it immediately follows a vowel.

      Returns null if the pronunciation for s is not found.

      Parameters:
      s - a Hawaiian consonant or a Hawaiian vowel followed by W.
      Returns:
      the English-sounding pronunciation of the consonant, or null if the pronunciation for s is not found

    • mapVowel

      public static String mapVowel(String s)
      Returns the English-sounding pronunciation of the vowel or vowel pair stored in s.

      Returns null if the pronunciation for s is not found.

      Parameters:
      s - a Hawaiian vowel or vowel pair
      Returns:
      the English-sounding pronunciation of the vowel or vowel pair, or null if the pronunciation for s is not found

    • handleSpace

      public static MappingResult handleSpace()
      Returns the MappingResult for the space character. The returned result has a value equal to " " and a charsConsumed value of 1.
      Returns:
      the MappingResult for the space character

    • handleConsonant

      public static MappingResult handleConsonant(char c, String word, int index)
      Returns the MappingResult for the consonant character c found in the string word at location index. If a mapping exists, then the returned result has a charsConsumed value of 1.

      word and index are used if c is equal to 'W' because the pronunciation of 'W' changes if it occurs after a vowel.

      Parameters:
      c - a Hawaiian consonant character
      word - the word containing c
      index - the index at which c occurs in word
      Returns:
      the MappingResult for the consonant character c or null if no such mapping is found

    • handleVowel

      public static MappingResult handleVowel(char c, String word, int index)
      Returns the MappingResult for the vowel character c found in the string word at location index. If a mapping exists, then the returned result has a charsConsumed value of 1 if c maps to a single vowel, or 2 if c and its following character map to a double vowel.

      word and index are used if c is followed by another vowel to handle the pronunciation of double vowels.

      Parameters:
      c - a Hawaiian consonant character
      word - the word containing c
      index - the index at which c occurs in word
      Returns:
      the MappingResult for the vowel character c or null if no such mapping is found

    • mapUnconsumed

      public static MappingResult mapUnconsumed(String word, int index)
      Computes the pronunciation mapping of the character located at index in the string word.
      Parameters:
      word - a word
      index - an index
      Returns:
      the pronunciation mapping of the character located at index in the string word, or null if no such mapping exists
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the index is out of bounds for word

    • pronounce

      public static String pronounce(String word)
      Computes the English pronunciation of a Hawaiian word. Syllables are separated using a '-' character.
      Parameters:
      word - a Hawaiian word
      Returns:
      the English pronunciation of word

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      For testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      args - not used
